answers.answer: Ur fine.  I wouldn't stress the measurements, they're usually off anyways.  My Dr at most has to me without measuring me at all, that she can tell my baby is in the higher percentile for size based on how big my belly looks.  I've already surpassed the recommended weight gain and my Dr isn't concerned at all and I'm almost 36 wks.

With my first I measured a month further along than I was, and then it switched to 2 weeks behind what I was. Those are benchmarks, not hard and fast rules. Also, if you were underweight to begin with, you may have just gained what you need to have a healthy baby. Just try to make healthy choices. If your Dr isn't concerned about your measurement, I wouldn't be either.

question: I am 27wks 5ds. I went to the doc yesterday and was told my blood count was at level 8, which is low. No diabetes or STDs. Gained 35lbs, which is the most docs want I to gain through out the whole pregnancy. My belly is measuring 30cm and it should only be 27cm. Also baby seems to be carrying very low. What's the deal?
title: measuring "big".
